Regulation Name(s): Device To Detect And Measure Non-Microbial Analyte(s) In Human Clinical Specimens To Aid In Assessment Of Patients With Suspected Sepsis
Document Summary: FDA 510(k) summary for MeMed BV test, an automated semi-quantitative immunoassay measuring TRAIL, IP-10, and CRP in serum and venous whole blood to aid in differentiating bacterial from viral infection.
Indications for Use Summary: Intended for use as an aid to differentiate bacterial from viral infection in adult and pediatric patients presenting to emergency or urgent care with suspected acute bacterial or viral infection of less than seven days' duration, using serum or venous whole blood samples, in conjunction with clinical assessments and other laboratory findings.
